name: fernery
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a garden, building, or glass container in which ferns (= green plants with long stems, leaves like feathers, and no flowers) are grown: In the formal gardens, we found exotic fruit, a fernery, and an Italian terrace. I cleared the high weeds and discovered a Victorian fernery.
More examplesFewer examplesAt the bottom of the garden was an old fernery and a riverside walk through fields.The Victorians collected ferns in their infinite variety in carefully crafted ferneries.We went out to Kew Gardens and looked through the various hot-houses and ferneries.
